data.title: Destination for faithful regulars
data.text: This restaurant is a favorite of my in-laws. They go at least once a week. Some regulars go 5 days a week. The attraction is that it is almost a "Cheers" atmosphere. The owner and servers are welcoming and remember your name and seating preference after just a few visits. The food is average to very good. There is a large aquarium at the entrance that attracts the little ones and is fun to sit next to while dining.

data.title: Reliably great food at reasonable prices.
data.text: We have enjoyed dining at the Golden Eagle, and often choose it for special occasions such as birthdays and anniversaries. The menu is varied and good, but we usually order the specials of the day. The specials usually are different, bordering on the unusual, and we've never been disappointed. I would recommend this restaurant for families, couples, and those who just want excellent food at decent prices in a nice atmosphere (no TV in the dining rooms).

data.title: Average at best
data.text: I have eaten here several times.  I have several friends that rave about it.  I wanted to Love this place because it's local for me.  The food is just ok, nothing for me to get excited about.  It wasn't bad, it was just ok.  The decor is a bit dated and tired, but clean.

data.title: A staple in Rochester must try
data.text: Family owned wonderful quaint place to enjoy a family dinner or a quiet night out. Burger is great, tenderloin with mario sauce is the bomb! Whitefish is great and the spaghetti with Bolognese sauce is hard to find anywhere else. You can't go wrong when eating here.  It makes you feel like you are visiting family when coming in.

data.title: Best Value in Town
data.text: Eat here at least twice a month.  The prime rib on Saturday is great and good value.  The tenderloin medallions with mario sauce is tops.  Fish and chips are really good.  Salads are fresh.  The location is at the end of a strip mall and not visible from the street.  But the place is always busy with the locals as the food and value received can't be beat.

data.title: Great Value
data.text: This is a cozy, homey bar/restaurant.  I visit this place at least 3 times a month. Their menu is not extensive, but they do what they do well.  The food is not trendy, but is well prepared and plentiful and reasonably priced.  They also have quite a list of daily specials.  Granted it is a throw back to the 60's, but a very pleasant experience, and boy do they decorate for the holidays.  The waitstaff has been there for as long as I can remember, and are wonderful.  They get to know their regulars. My mom's drink is on the table practically before we sit down.  We eat at lots of other places, but this one is a favorite.

data.title: Old fashioned but atmospheric
data.text: Admittedly, this is a throw-back to the '50's and '60's in style but a very comfortable place to dine.  The lighting is subdued, somewhat romantic even, and the menu is wide-ranging and relatively reasonable.  Their drink prices, however, are high.  It has the reputation of being for an older set and that's probably true but nothing is wrong with that.  The wait staff is good and most are quite exxperienced and one of the owners generally is on hand to greet you.

data.title: Very surprised for a first time visit.
data.text:
By looking at the outside of the building, I was shocked by the size inside.  A friend recommended going there so we did.  The wait time was around 20 minutes so we had drinks at the bar.  We were sat towards the back to the restaurant in a booth.  The Shrimp Scampi came out hot and was very good.  My husbands dinner, tenderloin tips in noodles came out hot.  My fish dinner with veggies was cold.  I wasn't feeling well so I had the server wrap it up to go.  I would have sent it back under regular circumstances.  It sat to long in the window.
There is no computer system so everything is done by "Old School" tickets.

data.title: Unusual Treats
data.text:
It's not often I can find two special and unusual favorites, namely Escargots and Frog Legs -- at the same restaurant.  Both were prepared with delicate flavoring that enhanced the experience.  The rest of our group had more standard fare, but I came back knowing these items were featured.

Now, if the owner and his staff can only improve the coupon experience (flexibility and clarity would help), I'd be happy to remove this one slightly negative comment.

data.title: DELICIOUS!
data.text: Fresh and a taste of heaven in your mouth - steak perfectly cooked; highly recommended for good eats and drinks!

data.title: Gray hair heaven
data.text: decor is fresh out of the 60s, and was not even nice then ... ambiance is like your dead aunts parlor ... menu is all over the place, they do Mexican, and Italian, and Greek, and American, and none of them very well ... service was slow and if you know what is good for you, don't ask them anything about the menu or if they can make anything the way you might like it

data.title: It was ok
data.text: Went here with an older couple who live behind us. It was ok, food was typical American dinner fair, a little dark atmosphere, seems to appeal to an elder crowd.

data.title: Try it!
data.text: The burgers here are the best! Ok, it's in a strip mall but the food is really good & the service is excellent. We especially like their Eagle's nest appetizer (like a blooming onion". We like to try their specials, the pork medallions are especially good.
